intro: Barneoudia chilensis var. major, commonly known as the Chilean barneoudia, is a flowering plant native to southern Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
